In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the implementation of this problem using Julia programming language.

First, make sure you have installed the necessary package `DataFrames` (if not already). You can do so by entering the following command into your Julia console: 
```julia
using Pkg; Pkg.add("DataFrames")
```

Now, define a function named `add_yearmonth`:

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = Dates.format.(df[:dt], "yyyyMM")
    return df
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame as an argument and adds a new column `ym` to it, which is the year and month part of each DateTime in `dt`.

You can then use this function on your DataFrame like so:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2022,1,1), DateTime(2023,2,28), DateTime(2024,3,31)]) 
print(add_yearmonth(df))
```
This will output:
```julia
7×2 DataFrame
│ Row │ dt              │ ym      │
│     │ DateTime        │ String? │
├─────┼─────────────────┼─────────┤
│ 1   │ 2022-01-01T00:00:00 │ 202201 │
│ 2   │ 2023-02-28T00:00:00 │ 202302 │
│ 3   │ 2024-03-31T00:00:00 │ 202403 │
```
